content.prompt: A student wants to determine the potential difference across the capacitor in the circuit shown above, which has reached equilibrium. The student only has an ammeter to collect data about the circuit. The student measures the current in resistor Y, of known resistance, and calculates the potential difference across Y. Which of the following explains why this will allow the potential difference across the capacitor to be determined?

choices.label: By the loop rule, this allows the emf of the battery to be determined, which is equal to the potential difference across the capacitor.
There is no current in the capacitor branch, so by the loop rule, the potential difference across Y equals the potential difference across the capacitor.
This allows the potential difference across resistor X to be determined, which is equal to the potential difference across the battery.
The potential differences across resistor Y, resistor Z, and the capacitor are the same.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
